project.teaser: COBIOE is project to interconnect innovation ecosystems to foster 4.0 industrial transition in the biopharmaceutical deeptech sector, sharing competences, information and opportunities, with the aim of ultimately converging toward a common and inclusive European strategy for...
project.objective: COBIOE is project to interconnect innovation ecosystems to foster 4.0 industrial transition in the biopharmaceutical deeptech sector, sharing competences, information and opportunities, with the aim of ultimately converging toward a common and inclusive European strategy for bioproduction support. Specifically, the proposition will focus on the bioproduction sector that includes development of small molecules, biologics, drugs, innovative therapeutics (such as gene and cellular therapies), high technology drugs based on cell and molecular biology, and covers various applications in health (oncology, immunology, virology, rare diseases, etc…). COBIOE will reach the following objectives: - Provide a state of the art and exploitable overview of the European bioproduction value chain, focusing on European, national, regional strategy or existing initiatives, activities - Opening up the bioproduction field, by reaching out to isolated actors and territories bringing added value to the chain. - Building up bridges between sparse innovative ecosystems and initiatives opening up opportunities for isolated players. - Promote bioproduction ecosystems, the field and its potentialities in terms of green, digital and social transition, among various stakeholders and policymakers COBIOE proposal includes 5 health clusters/networks, preeminent and pioneers in the field of pharmaceutical biomanufacturing. Each partner complements each other in terms of competence and the partnership covers almost all European regions from north to south and east to west, including modest, moderate, strong and leading innovators. Moreover, each partner benefits from an extended network of stakeholders, from different technological sectors (materials science, artificial intelligence, biotechnology, blockchain, robotics, photonics, electronics and quantum information) and actors (universities, research, hospitals, funders…).

result.title: Virtual Bioproduction Value chain representation online
result.description: Virtual representation of the value chain available online.

result.title: Joint Action Plans
result.description: 9 plans (one per focus group) describing the activities and actions to be set collectively by the groups stakeholders during and after the project.

result.title: COBIOE value chain hub
result.description: An online, interactive destination where stakeholders can explore, interact and engage online along the digital Value chain. The content in each value chain part divided in 9 focus identified as key for bioprodruction scaling up. On this space, participants can find relevant info and data for their respective field.

result.title: COBIOE connection platform
result.description: A dedicated space, where bioproduction stakeholders can register, create their profile, find relevant information from the project such as deliverables, events, and documentation. This platform will be connected and integrated with EIT virtual spaces.

result.title: Communication and Dissemination plan
result.description: Communication and Dissemination plan

result.title: 2 Joint actions progress report
result.description: 2nd report monitoring the results of focus groups dialogue. Including: state of the art, assessment and recommendation for adjustment.

result.title: Joint Connection Plan
result.description: Document as a basis to plan collaborative actions to be set between ecosystems. Connection Plan must guide us through the scale-up support action toward industrialisation of bioproduction ecosystems. The connection Plan will help us to translate priorities into strategies and further develop a string of joint activities aimed at the implementation of our strategy (WP4).

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: It includes an analysis of the main elements of the data management policy that will be used with regard to the project. DMP will include: [1] Data set reference and name; [2] Data set description (origin, nature, usefulness, etc.); [3] Standards and metadata; [4] Data sharing (access procedures); [5] Archiving and preservation (long-term preservation procedures).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
